content:
Sure, here is some information about the pricing plans for the cloud gaming services I mentioned earlier:

1. Google Stadia: Google Stadia offers two pricing plans - a free plan and a Pro plan. The free plan allows you to purchase games individually and play them at up to 1080p resolution. The Pro plan costs $9.99 per month and includes access to a library of free games, as well as the ability to stream games at up to 4K resolution with HDR and 5.1 surround sound.

2. GeForce Now: GeForce Now offers a free plan and a paid plan. The free plan allows you to play for up to one hour at a time, with standard priority access to servers. The paid plan costs $9.99 per month and allows you to play for longer periods without interruptions, with priority access to servers.

3. Xbox Game Pass Ultimate: Xbox Game Pass Ultimate costs $14.99 per month and includes access to a library of over 100 games, as well as the ability to stream games to your PC, mobile phone or tablet.

4. PlayStation Now: PlayStation Now offers two pricing plans - a monthly plan and an annual plan. The monthly plan costs $9.99 per month and the annual plan costs $59.99 per year. Both plans include access to a library of hundreds of games, as well as the ability to stream games to your computer or PlayStation console.

Keep in mind that the pricing plans for these services may vary by region, and some services may offer additional plans or options. There may also be additional costs for purchasing games or for additional features like premium graphics or ray tracing.
